required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Scalable Communication Modalities for Returning Genetic Research Results
clinical_study.official_title: Testing Scalable Communication Modalities for Returning Breast Cancer Genetic Research Results to African American Women

brief_summary.textblock: Efforts to examine the utility of alternate modalities for genetic results disclosure has widespread implications for how precision medicine research might yield direct health benefits for study participants. This study will examine the efficacy of an online self-guided program to return genetic results to a racial minority cohort population. Study results will provide empirical evidence on the effectiveness of alternate modalities for genetic results return, inform ongoing efforts to establish scalable approaches for effective return of genetic research results, and increase access to personal health information among African American women.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a randomized controlled trial (RCT) within the Black Women's Health Study (BWHS) to test alternate communication modalities for results disclosure. The BWHS is an ongoing prospective cohort study of 59,000 self-identified black women from across the United States who have been followed since 1995. Targeted sequencing of over 4000 women within the cohort for BRCA1/2 and other known or suspected high and moderate penetrance genes opens up the possibility of returning breast cancer genetic results to BWHS participants and examining the clinical utility of genetic results return. The primary aim of the proposed research project is to compare the efficacy of two communication modalities for returning breast cancer genetic research results to African American women: 1) a conventional modality that entails telephone disclosure by a licensed genetic counselor, and 2) an online self-guided modality that entails returning results directly to participants, with optional genetic counselor follow-up via telephone. Secondary aims of this study will examine 1) moderators of the intervention impact and 2) psychosocial, sociodemographic, and clinical predictors of result uptake. This study is uniquely situated to provide critical empirical evidence on the effectiveness of alternate models for genetic results return and provide further insight into the factors influencing uptake of genetic information among African American women.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participant that decide to learn genetic results at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Decisions about learning genetic results for hereditary breast and ovarian cancer will be monitored and recorded in the electronic study database system.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participant that decide to learn genetic results at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Decisions about learning genetic results for hereditary breast and ovarian cancer will be monitored and recorded in the electronic study database system.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in breast cancer genetics knowledge based on questionnaire at responses at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Knowledge about breast cancer genetics will be assessed using an investigator derived questionnaire consisting of 10 items. Higher scores out of ten are associated with more genetics knowledge.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline anxiety or depression (general psychological distress) at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depression will be assessed using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale (HADS). This is a 14 item measure with scores ranging from 0-21 with higher scores reflecting greater anxiety or depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Anxiety or depression (general psychological distress) at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depression will be assessed using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale (HADS). This is a 14 item measure with scores ranging from 0-21 with higher scores reflecting greater anxiety or depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Anxiety or depression (general psychological distress) at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Anxiety and depression will be assessed using the Hospital Anxiety and Depression scale (HADS). This is a 14 item measure with scores ranging from 0-21 with higher scores reflecting greater anxiety or depression.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant distress from cancer risk assessment (test-specific distress) at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using the Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Assessment (MICRA) distress subscale, the investigators will assess perceptions of distress resulting from learning genetic test results. The distress subscale has 6 items, each scored on a 4 point scale, with higher scores reflecting greater distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant distress from cancer risk assessment (test-specific distress) at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Using the Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Assessment (MICRA) distress subscale, the investigators will assess perceptions of distress resulting from learning genetic test results. The distress subscale has 6 items, each scored on a 4 point scale, with higher scores reflecting greater distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant distress from cancer risk assessment (test-specific distress) at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Using the Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Assessment (MICRA) distress subscale, the investigators will assess perceptions of distress resulting from learning genetic test results. The distress subscale has 6 items, each scored on a 4 point scale, with higher scores reflecting greater distress.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant uncertainty from cancer risk assessment at 6 weeks
primary_outcome.description: Using the Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Assessment (MICRA) uncertainty subscale, the investigators will assess perceptions of uncertainty resulting from learning genetic test results. Then uncertainty subscale has 9 items, each scored on a 4 point scale, with higher scores reflecting greater uncertainty.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant uncertainty from cancer risk assessment at 6 months
primary_outcome.description: Using the Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Assessment (MICRA) uncertainty subscale, the investigators will assess perceptions of uncertainty resulting from learning genetic test results. Then uncertainty subscale has 9 items, each scored on a 4 point scale, with higher scores reflecting greater uncertainty.

primary_outcome.measure: Participant uncertainty from cancer risk assessment at 12 months
primary_outcome.description: Using the Multidimensional Impact of Cancer Risk Assessment (MICRA) uncertainty subscale, the investigators will assess perceptions of uncertainty resulting from learning genetic test results. Then uncertainty subscale has 9 items, each scored on a 4 point scale, with higher scores reflecting greater uncertainty.

arm_group.description: Control arm. Conventional modality entails telephone disclosure of genetic results by a licensed genetic counselor.
Online self-guided modality entails return of genetic results directly to participants, with optional genetic counselor follow-up via telephone.

intervention.description: Return of BRCA results directly online or return of printed BRCA results if participant cannot access online or chooses not to
Optional genetic counselor follow-up over the telephone

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
-Women in the BWHS previously included in the targeted breast cancer sequencing project
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with known cognitive impairments
- Women with variant of uncertain significance (VUS) results from the sequencing study

condition_browse.mesh_term: Hereditary Breast and Ovarian Cancer Syndrome
